text.p: These are the leading stories in the Tunisian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Zine al-Abidine Ben Ali on Wednesday chaired a cabinet meeting which discussed creating an institute to train diplomats, new legislation on precious metals, and speeding up the modernisation programme of industry.
- Tunisia celebrates on Thursday the Moslem new year Ras el-Am al-Hejri.
- Interior Minister Mohamed Ben Rejeb on Wednesday received a delegation from the Tunisian League for the Defense of Human Rights. Interior Ministry services will facilitate the league's activities.
- Prime Minister Hamed Karoui to go to France on Friday to hand French President Jacques Chirac a message from Ben Ali.
- Foreign Affairs Minister Abderrahim Zouari brifed Ben Ali on the results of his visit this week to Libya during which he met Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi.
- Farmers association study showed that average per capita consumption of meat was 20 kg (44 lbs) per year.
- President recommends boosting relations with Libya.
